boardgame.description: Get ready to enter the poor and dreary Whitechapel district in London 1888 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; the scene of the mysterious Jack the Ripper murders _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; with its crowded and smelly alleys, hawkers, shouting merchants, dirty children covered in rags who run through the crowd and beg for money, and prostitutes _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; called _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;the wretched_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; on every street corner._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The board game Letters from Whitechapel, which plays in 90-150 minutes, takes the players right there. One player plays Jack the Ripper, and his goal is to take five victims before being caught. The other players are police detectives who must cooperate to catch Jack the Ripper before the end of the game. The game board represents the Whitechapel area at the time of Jack the Ripper and is marked with 199 numbered circles linked together by dotted lines. During play, Jack the Ripper, the Policemen, and the Wretched are moved along the dotted lines that represent Whitechapel's streets. Jack the Ripper moves stealthily between numbered circles, while policemen move on their patrols between crossings, and the Wretched wander alone between the numbered circles._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2011 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee

listing.notes: Nexus (NEX LDT003) Jack The Ripper_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s murders and the desperate attempts by Scotland Yard to stop him, in a very tense game: night after night, the player who controls Jack commits a new murder and tries to reach his hideout, while the other players, in the role of British police detectives, try to track him down, tightening the investigation_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s lace around the serial killer at each turn, in a race against time.

Nexus (NEX LDT003) Jack The Ripper_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s murders and the desperate attempts by Scotland Yard to stop him, in a very tense game: night after night, the player who controls Jack commits a new murder and tries to reach his hideout, while the other players, in the role of British police detectives, try to track him down, tightening the investigation_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s lace around the serial killer at each turn, in a race against time.

LETTERS FROM WHITECHAPEL: $30.95 Nexus Games [NEX 003] SHIPPING Continental U.S. - FedEx: $13.95 International (Including AK _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; HI) - USPS Priority Mail :TBD

*** 4th Dimension Games *** Letters from Whitechapel: $32.49 In Stock (7% sales tax for residents of Pennsylvania) This is a New, Sealed in Box Letter from Whitechapel board game. Publisher: Nexus [NGILTD003] Number of Players: 2-6 Ages: 14+ Length: 150 minutes Shipping: Shipping rates will be determined upon sale or request. Insurance is optional but highly recommended for higher priced items. The shipping costs are NOT inflated. You pay exactly what I am charged for shipping, along with material costs. I ship through FedEx or USPS, whichever is cheaper. Normal shipping costs run from $8.00 - $11.00. If you have a commercial address that I can send to, your shipping costs will be even less! Payment: I accept PayPal, money orders, personal and cashier_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s checks. Personal checks will be accepted but I will wait until the check has cleared before sending the item. Return Policy: I want you to be completely satisfied with your item. Because of this, I will accept return of any item for a refund of the purchase price within 30 days of the sale. The item must be in the same condition that it was sent. I cannot refund the shipping cost.

Fantasy Flight Games (FFGVA88) Letters from Whitechapel is a thematically engrossing board game of deduction and bluffing in which one player takes the role of the infamous Jack the Ripper, while up to five other players are detectives working together to pursue him through Victorian London. After committing his horrible murders, Jack must outmaneuver the detectives in the tangled streets of the Whitechapel District. Meanwhile, the detectives must use clever deduction and their superior numbers to hunt Jack the Ripper down before he can kill again or elude them forever.
RESERVED FOR AUCTION WINNER RICHARDHMARSHALL This is NOT the FFG edition. Nexus English edition. Brand new still in shrink. Excellent condition.

After committing his horrible murders, Jack must outmaneuver the detectives in the tangled streets of the Whitechapel District. Meanwhile, the detectives must use clever deduction and their superior numbers to hunt Jack the Ripper down before he can kill again or elude them forever.
